description: From Middle English careful, from Old English carful; equivalent to care +â€Ž -ful.

adjectives.description: careful (comparative more careful or carefuller, superlative most careful or carefullest)

entries.meaning: Taking care; attentive to potential danger, error or harm; cautious.
examples: He was a slow and careful driver.
Be very careful while trekking through the jungle.
They made a careful search of the crime scene.

entries.meaning: (obsolete) Full of care or grief; sorrowful, sad.
(obsolete) Full of cares or anxiety; worried, troubled.
